questions.question: Which choice best describes AI?

options.d: A computer's ability to mimic human intelligence with no data input whatsoever
options.a: A machine's ability to learn from experience, without explicit programming, to perform functions usually associated with the human mind
options.c: An extremely limited class of systems able to mimic human-like capabilities
options.b: A machine's ability to learn, requiring specific programming, to perform functions typically associated with the human mind

questions.question: Which choice best explains machine learning (ML)?

options.a: A learning approach that makes the best possible decisions through virtual trial and error
options.c: A learning approach using layered neural networks specifically to solve speech recognition
options.b: A learning approach using algorithms that improve with exposure to more data over time
options.d: A learning model that only relies on algorithms for functions like regression, classification, and clustering

questions.question: Which statement about deep learning (DL) is FALSE?

options.a: DL is not well-suited for usages like computer vision or speech recognition
options.b: DL avoids the 'reverse engineering' features required with traditional machine learning algorithms
options.c: DL uses layered neural networks that learn from vast amounts of data
options.d: DL's neural network automatically adjusts and adapts to every new piece of training data

questions.question: Which statement about AI is TRUE?

options.b: AI has fully replaced statistical analytics
options.a: Implementing a 'one size fits all' AI solution across verticals is easy with the right compute hardware
options.c: Each AI problem demands a different solution based on data, solution requirements and cost complexity considerations
options.d: AI is currently only being employed by a small subset of the largest enterprise customers

questions.question: What are the three broad types of learning in AI?

options.b: Supervised, Unsupervised, Reinforcement learning

questions.question: What type of learning allows a robotic arm to adapt to real-time conditions and specific materials?

options.b: Unsupervised learning

questions.question: What are some unsupervised learning tactics used in machine learning?

options.b: Speech processing and Data generation

questions.question: What are some unsupervised learning tactics used in deep learning?

options.c: Image processing, Recommender systems, and Speech processing
options.b: Classification and Regression

questions.question: Why might companies employ clustering with a K-means algorithm using unlabeled data?

options.c: To extract insight for categorizing their customers in order to target advertising spending
options.a: To automatically detect defects in products
options.d: To classify pictures into one of three different categories
options.b: To learn in progress based solely on positive and negative feedback

questions.question: What combination is driving current innovation in reinforcement learning?

options.d: Combining Turing testing with multiple choice testing
options.c: Combining unsupervised learning with natural language processing
options.b: Combining RL algorithms and classification algorithms
options.a: Combining RL algorithms with deep neural networks

questions.question: How was an AI Go player trained to compete against the world's best human player?

options.a: With image processing algorithms to detect facial expressions
options.c: With reinforcement learning algorithms, using trial and error to learn to make the best decisions possible
options.b: With adversarial network algorithms to detect how to win against any adversary
options.d: With K-means algorithms to predict next moves far into the future

questions.question: What is a 'framework' as it relates to deep learning models?

options.c: A collection of geometrical instructions commonly used in higher-level applications
options.a: A different configuration of a neural network used to solve a given problem
options.b: A pre-configured 'AI-in-a-box' solution
options.d: A programming environment using built-in libraries, functions, visualization tools and more to help speed DL development

questions.question: How many topologies exist or are in development for neural networks?

options.b: About 10

questions.question: A 'container' as it relates to AI can best be described as:

options.c: A math kernel library for deep neural networks
options.d: A virtual enclosure to prevent AI from becoming too intelligent
options.a: A pre-configured 'AI-in-a-box' environment that has some combination of library, framework and/or topology
options.b: A wealth of resources available online to help understand different approaches to AI

questions.question: How many open-source frameworks for AI exist or are in development?

options.b: Dozens

questions.question: Angela seeks higher yields with variables like temperature, humidity, and material purity. What AI approach would best help?

options.a: Gaussian Neural Analysis to learn which variables correlate to yield
options.b: Deep learning (supervised) to learn which variables correlate to yield
options.c: Machine learning (unsupervised) to learn which variables correlate to yield
options.d: Deep learning (reinforcement) to learn which variables correlate to yield

questions.question: For a recall on mismanufactured seatbelt parts, what AI approach will best help the manufacturer?

options.b: Machine learning (unsupervised) to identify defects

questions.question: The task of a trained neural network determining what object is shown in an unknown image is called:

options.b: Clustering

questions.question: A real danger for businesses not wanting to step into AI space is:

options.d: Running out of inventory upon any increase in orders
options.b: Not ever being able to respond to changes in market conditions

questions.question: What is one clear factor currently driving the surge in AI?

options.a: The exponential rise in the amount of data
options.b: More people working from home
options.c: Companies being less dependent on IT
options.d: Companies having more money to spend

questions.question: How many gigabytes of data did a typical smart car generate daily in 2019?

options.b: 50 GB

questions.question: How many gigabytes of data did an average Internet user generate monthly in 2019?

options.b: 8 PB

questions.question: How many more smart connected devices are expected to exist in 2022 than the global population?

options.b: 5x more

questions.question: Which are considered specific stages of analytic advancement?

options.b: Hindsight, Insight, Foresight, Forecast

questions.question: Descriptive and Diagnostic Analytics are sometimes referred to as:

options.b: Spectral Analytics

questions.question: Predictive, Prescriptive and Cognitive Analytics are all sometimes referred to as:

options.b: Advanced Analytics

questions.question: What recent advancement gave us tools to extract valuable insights from data?

options.c: Breakthroughs in computation performance and innovation in Analytics and AI
options.b: Allen Newell and Herbert A. Simon's debut of the 'Logic Theorist'

questions.question: What do AI solutions contribute to electrical power production and distribution?

options.b: Delivering 2x more power per cubic foot of water

questions.question: What do AI solutions contribute to the Telecommunications market?

options.c: They automate international calling plan opt-ins
options.a: They eliminate the need for Accounts Receivable departments
options.b: They drive network and operational efficiency
options.d: They reduce the need for SIM cards

questions.question: How many networked devices are expected to exist in 2022?

options.b: 750 million

questions.question: Which best describes 'Advanced Analytics'?

options.c: They help us understand what happened and why
options.a: They help us predict and plan for the future
options.d: Advanced Analytics are still in the research phase
options.b: They eliminate any possibility of future trends impacting a business

questions.question: Which best describes 'Operational Analytics'?

options.a: They help us streamline factory assembly lines
options.b: They help us predict and plan for the future
options.c: They help us understand what happened and why
options.d: They help us spot future trends across interwoven industries

questions.question: What are the four phases of Intel's AI journey in correct order?

options.b: Model, Data, Discover, Deploy

questions.question: What happens in the 'Discover' phase of the AI journey?

options.b: You consider secondary impacts of AI implementation
options.a: You identify potential AI opportunities, including solutions in Intel AI Builders program
options.c: You prioritize best AI approaches with experts
options.d: You plan organizational buy-in and build talent

questions.question: Which main AI journey step is one of the biggest barriers and often overlooked?

options.b: Properly building the MODEL

questions.question: Which three are popular data ingest software tools?

options.b: Incendia, Chaoscope, Kafka

questions.question: When organizing the AI data layer, what four actions need to be taken with data?

options.b: Source, store, prepare, and stage

questions.question: During which step might legacy CPU performance require an accelerator?

options.b: When deploying the AI

questions.question: Which statement about GPUs versus CPUs in deep learning is true?

options.d: Using GPU accelerator is the only option for deep learning
options.a: Most customers starting with AI have enough demand to justify GPU expense
options.c: Most customers starting with AI do not have enough deep learning demand to justify GPU expense
options.b: GPUs are always more cost effective than CPUs

questions.question: What helps bridge gaps between CPUs and GPU accelerators for AI?

options.b: Vertex shaders
options.d: Intel's strategy of extending CPU architecture with AI enhancements and software optimizations
options.a: Data ingestion streams requiring no cleaning

questions.question: When a trained AI model reaches sufficient accuracy, what happens next?

options.b: It's rarely retrained as it can automatically adjust
options.d: It's guaranteed to provide accurate business forecasts
options.c: It's tested against a control data set to determine if accuracy meets requirements

questions.question: What key things should be captured when documenting a model ready for deployment?

options.c: The software code itself, the process, and any key learnings
options.d: How stakeholders feel about AI implementation
options.a: Time spent, money spent, and deadlines
options.b: Whether storing data on block storage will work best

questions.question: In the underwater drone scenario, what specialized software was used for AI implementation?

options.b: Intel Distribution of OpenVINO Toolkit, Intel Movidius SDK, and Intel Optimization for TensorFlow
options.a: PyTorch, Apache Spark, and Intel oneAPI AI Analytics Toolkit
options.d: PaddlePaddle using Intel Math Kernel Library and MXNet
options.c: Intel Extension for Scikit-Learn, Modin, and Intel Optimization for Caffe

questions.question: In the underwater drone scenario, what hardware was used in the data center?

options.a: Intel Xeon processor-based servers with Intel SSD storage
options.d: Only Intel Movidius Vision Processing Units
options.b: Intel Habana Gaudi and Goya processors with SSD storage

questions.question: What does 'continuous iterative improvement' mean in the AI case study?

options.c: Stakeholder meetings to lower future expenses
options.d: Replacing an older AI model with a completely new one
options.a: The AI continuing to improve on its own without additional training
options.b: Periodically re-training the AI model with newly ingested and processed data

questions.question: What Intel partner program can help when first embarking on an AI journey?

options.b: Intel Foundry Services

questions.question: Why is a single data pipeline more efficient for AI training than a fragmented one?

options.c: Because deep learning time to solution is always shorter
options.d: Because data preparation and inference workloads run well on CPU and make up majority of time to solution
options.a: Because GPUs can only process one small task at a time
options.b: Because AI training is not graphics intensive

questions.question: What should you research about macro-level forces in AI adoption?

options.b: Industry dynamics driving AI adoption in various sectors

questions.question: What should be analyzed in company-specific research for AI adoption?

options.b: Financial reports to identify AI-related strategic initiatives

questions.question: What should be prepared when engaging with customers about AI?

options.b: Questions to assess customer's AI readiness and challenges

questions.question: What are team owners in racing primarily interested in regarding AI?

options.b: Forming competitive teams and focus on performance and safety metrics

questions.question: How do business line managers view AI?

options.b: As a broad concept needing operationalization, concerned with business challenges
options.a: As a technical detail requiring deep understanding

questions.question: What do IT solution architects prioritize when designing AI solutions?

options.b: Total cost of ownership, security, and manageability

questions.question: What do AI developers focus on?

options.b: Data management, time to solution, and ease of use in tools

questions.question: What does Intel offer to support AI needs?

options.c: A comprehensive AI hardware portfolio and software stack
options.b: Only software solutions

questions.question: What is required for effective engagement with different AI audiences?

options.a: Using the same approach for everyone
options.b: Understanding their specific needs and highlighting Intel's strengths

questions.question: What type of learning uses labeled data for training?

options.b: Supervised learning

questions.question: What type of learning finds insights from unlabeled data?

options.b: Unsupervised learning

questions.question: What type of learning uses trial and error with rewards and penalties?

options.b: Unsupervised learning

questions.question: What is a key characteristic of deep learning?

options.b: Uses layered neural networks

questions.question: What makes deep learning particularly suitable for computer vision?

options.b: It can automatically learn features from images through layered networks

questions.question: What is the main advantage of machine learning algorithms?

options.d: They work the same regardless of data quality
options.b: They improve performance with more data exposure

questions.question: What is a neural network topology?

options.b: A specific configuration of a neural network for solving problems

questions.question: What is the purpose of AI libraries?

options.b: Collections of pre-written instructions for AI development

questions.question: Why is data preprocessing important in AI?

options.b: It ensures data quality and format consistency for model training

questions.question: What is the main challenge with data silos in AI?

options.b: They prevent comprehensive data analysis and model training

questions.question: What is a data lake?

options.b: A centralized repository for storing structured and unstructured data

questions.question: Why might CPU-only solutions be preferred for some AI workloads?

options.b: They're more cost-effective for workloads that don't require massive parallel processing

questions.question: What is model validation in AI?

options.b: Testing the model against control datasets to verify accuracy

questions.question: Why is documentation important in AI model development?

options.b: It captures the process, code, and learnings for future reference and improvement

questions.question: What is model retraining?

options.b: Updating the model with new data to maintain or improve accuracy

questions.question: What is the role of Intel Movidius VPUs in edge AI?

options.b: Specialized processing for AI inference at the edge with low power consumption

questions.question: What is the main benefit of edge AI processing?

options.b: Reduced latency and bandwidth requirements by processing data locally

questions.question: What should be considered when assessing AI readiness?

options.b: Data availability, talent, and regulatory concerns

questions.question: What is the significance of understanding different stakeholder perspectives in AI?

options.b: Different roles have different priorities and concerns that must be addressed

questions.question: What is the relationship between data volume and AI model performance?

options.b: More quality data generally improves model performance

questions.question: What is the primary driver behind the current AI boom?

options.b: Exponential growth in data generation from connected devices

questions.question: Why is AI becoming critical for business competitiveness?

options.b: Companies without AI risk being overtaken by competitors who leverage AI effectively

questions.question: What distinguishes advanced analytics from operational analytics?

options.a: Advanced analytics only look at historical data
options.b: Advanced analytics focus on prediction and planning for the future

questions.question: What is the expected growth in connected devices by 2022?

options.b: Devices will be 2x global population

questions.question: What percentage of CIOs are expected to aggressively apply AI to IT operations by 2021?
What is the main purpose of clustering algorithms in business?

options.b: To categorize customers for targeted marketing and advertising

questions.question: What makes reinforcement learning particularly effective for game playing?

options.b: It learns optimal strategies through trial and error with reward feedback

questions.question: What is the key advantage of using containers in AI development?

options.b: They provide pre-configured environments with libraries, frameworks, and tools

questions.question: What is the main challenge in the data layer of AI projects?

options.b: Properly ingesting, storing, preparing, and managing data from various sources

questions.question: Why might a GPU sit idle in many AI implementations?

options.b: Most customers don't have enough deep learning demand to justify constant GPU usage

questions.question: What is Intel's approach to making CPUs more AI-capable?

options.b: Extending CPU architecture with AI enhancements and software optimizations

options.b: Intel Movidius Vision Processing Units

options.a: It only works with Intel hardware
options.b: It optimizes AI inference performance across different Intel hardware platforms

options.b: Macro-level forces and recent AI implementations relevant to the industry

questions.question: What type of research should be conducted on potential AI customers?

options.b: Contact-level research to find common ground and assess AI readiness

questions.question: How do C-suite executives typically view AI initiatives?

options.b: As broad business concepts that need operationalization to address business challenges

questions.question: What do data scientists primarily focus on in AI projects?

options.b: Data management, algorithm selection, and model performance

questions.question: What is the importance of understanding different AI audience needs?

options.a: It's not important - one size fits all
options.d: Everyone focuses on the same outcomes

questions.question: What is the relationship between AI and traditional statistical analytics?

options.d: Statistical analytics is superior to AI
options.b: AI enhances and works alongside traditional analytics methods
options.a: AI has completely replaced statistical analytics

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'Act/Adapt' stage in analytics?

options.b: It represents the ability to automatically respond and adapt to insights

questions.question: Why is AI particularly valuable in telecommunications?

options.a: It eliminates the need for infrastructure
options.b: It drives network and operational efficiency in complex systems
options.c: It reduces the need for customers

questions.question: At Intel, we help guide customers in all phases of their AI journey. What are these four phases in the correct order?

options.b: Model, Data, Discover, Deploy

questions.question: The first step in the AI journey is the "Discover" phase. What happens in this step? (Select all that apply.)

options.c: You prioritize best AI approaches with Intel experts to find which one likely delivers the highest ROI.
options.b: You consider secondary impacts of AI implementation, such as any legal, social, security, and/or ethical issues.
options.d: You plan the organizational buy-in, and build up the right talent.
options.a: You identify potential AI opportunities, including combing 70+ solutions in the Intel® AI Builders program.

questions.question: Which main AI journey step is one of the biggest barriers to AI and is often overlooked?

options.b: Properly building the MODEL.

questions.question: Which three are popular data ingest software tools? (Select the three that apply.)

options.b: Sqoop*

questions.question: When organizing the AI data layer, what four actions need to be taken with the data?

options.b: Source, store, prepare, and stage.

questions.question: During which step of an AI journey will limitations based on the legacy CPU's performance potentially require the need for an accelerator?

options.b: When deploying the AI.
options.d: When discovering which popular AI tools are best for the job.

questions.question: Which statements are true regarding use of GPUs versus CPUs in deep learning AI solutions? (Select all that apply.)

options.d: Using a GPU accelerator is the only option for deep learning.
options.b: Unlike a CPU, a GPU may sit idle most of the time, consuming capital, power and space.
options.c: Recent advancements mean CPU's can be used without GPU's, and are often more cost effective.
options.a: Most customers starting with AI do not have enough deep learning demand to justify a GPU's expense.

questions.question: What helps bridge some gaps between CPUs and GPU accelerators for use in AI?

options.d: Intel's strategy of continuing to extend CPU architecture with more AI enhancements and software optimizations.
options.a: Data ingestion streams that require no data cleaning or data preprocessing.
options.b: Vertex shaders.

questions.question: When a sufficiently high level of accuracy is first reached by a trained AI model, the model is _____.

options.c: tested against a control data set to determine if accuracy meets the requirements
options.d: guaranteed to provide accurate business forecasts
options.b: rarely retrained as it can automatically adjust to changing data over time

questions.question: When documenting information after a model has been sufficently tested and ready for deployment, what are key things to capture?

options.a: Time spent, money spent, and any deadlines.
options.d: How stakeholders feel about fully committing to AI implementation.
options.c: The software code itself, the process, and any key learnings.
options.b: Whether storing data on block storage in a data lake will work best (or not).

questions.question: In the underwater drone scenario in the course, what specialized software was used to implement AI in the production environment?

options.a: PyTorch*, Apache Spark*, and Intel® oneAPI AI Analytics Toolkit
options.b: Intel® Distribution of OpenVINO™ Toolkit, Intel® Movidius™ SDK, and Intel® Optimization for TensorFlow* with oneDNN (formerly Intel MKL-DNN).
options.c: Intel® Extension for Scikit-Learn*, Modin*, and Intel® Optimization for Caffe*
options.d: PaddlePaddle* using Intel® Math Kernel Library for Deep Neural Networks and MXNet*

questions.question: In the underwater drone scenario in the course, what hardware was used to implement AI in the production environment? (Select all that apply.)

options.c: Intel® Neural Compute Stick 2s in the drones.
options.d: Intel® Movidius™ Vision Processing Units (VPUs) in the drones.
options.b: A whole lot of Intel® Habana Gaudi® and Goya processors with SSD storage in the data center.
options.a: A whole lot of Intel® Xeon® processor-based servers with Intel® SSD storage in the data center.

questions.question: What does "continuous iterative improvement" mean in this course's AI case study?

options.b: Periodically re-training the AI model with newly ingested and processed data.
options.c: Stakeholder meetings to lower future expenses whenever possible.
options.a: The AI continuing to improve on its own without additional training.
options.d: Replacing an older AI model with a completely new one.

questions.question: What Intel partner enabling program can help when first embarking on an AI journey?

options.b: Intel® Foundry Services (IFS)

questions.question: For AI training, why is it more efficient to have a single data pipeline (CPU only) than a fragmented data pipeline (offloading certain workloads to GPUs)?

options.b: Because AI training is not graphics intensive.
options.c: Because deep learning time to solution is always shorter through a single data pipeline.
options.a: Because GPUs can only process one small task at a time.
options.e: Because AI training does not require multitasking.
options.d: Because data preparation and inference workloads, which can make up the majority of the overall time to solution, run well on a CPU.

questions.question: From this course, what is the first step in preparing for an initial meeting where AI will be the main agenda?

options.b: Mapping out the full AI plan.
options.a: Understanding the macro-level forces that drove the customer's vertical segment toward AI.
options.d: Building a rough AI model relevant to your potential customer's needs.

questions.question: What is often cited as a typical customer expectation of AI?

options.c: Increasing overall customer satisfaction through the use of chatbots.
options.b: Improving marketing efforts.
options.d: Cost savings, with the hope to streamline operations and drive labor costs down.

questions.question: According to this course, which of the following are key barriers for customers considering adoption of an AI solution? (Select all that apply.)

options.c: Lack of cloud capacity when deploying fully tested AI models.
options.d: Attracting, hiring and retaining talent. AI is a highly competitive market.
options.a: Data. Is there the right data and enough of it?
options.b: Security and regulatory concerns, such as Europe's General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

questions.question: Why is it important to read a potential AI customer's letter to shareholders in their annual report?

options.c: To understand what the executive team believes to be its most important strategic initiatives and challenges.
options.d: To determine the most competitive pricing for the job.
options.b: To evaluate if any key stakeholders will object to company AI initiatives.
options.a: To get a clear picture of the company's hardware depreciation schedule.
options.e: To calculate the amount of clean data that will be available for effective AI model training and deployment.

questions.question: What is it important to be aware of an executive's past accomplishments?

options.d: To navigate the nuance of stakeholder relationships.
options.b: To fully scope the initial AI investment likely to be made.
options.a: It gives you a better understanding how to position your product or service.
options.c: To be invited to more free lunches.

questions.question: Most new AI accounts will be in which specific stage of the AI lifecycle?

options.b: Infrastructure.

questions.question: According to this course, roughly how many organizations have gone full circle in the AI lifecycle?

options.b: Less than 1%.

questions.question: What happens during the "Expertise" stage in the AI lifecycle?

options.d: The AI model training is complete, and the AI solution is readied for deployment.
options.b: A team of experts identify the right data and translate it to achieve results.
options.c: The AI team breaks down the defined business problem into workable steps.
options.a: The organization secures hardware and software to support timely data processing.

questions.question: What is the first step in any AI journey?

options.b: Prioritizing analytic development work.
options.c: Defining the challenge you want to solve.

questions.question: Which statement is false about AI?

options.d: AI is complex and potentially very costly.
options.c: In many cases, your customer might be able to accomplish their objectives without AI.
options.a: No matter the goal, the optimal AI approach is going to be the same.
options.e: You must figure out which AI (or other) approach is best-suited to each problem early in the process.
options.b: Deep learning using image recognition may be the right approach to identify manufacturing defects.

questions.question: Once you have identifed the challenges faced across an organization, how should you prioritize them for possible AI (or other) solutions?

options.a: Based on how much time you have to fully dedicate to each challenge.
options.d: Based on what will amass the most publicity from your efforts.
options.c: Based on what a majority of shareholders thinks best.
options.b: Based on the complexity of the challenges.
options.e: Based on what will deliver maximum business value at the lowest cost.

questions.question: In our widget example, where would investing in AI deep learning be the most obvious solution?

options.b: In more efficiently identifying manufacturing defects.
options.c: In determining what the yield will be.
options.d: In choosing what machinery would be best for the job.

questions.question: In our widget example, where should you seriously question whether to implement a potentially more complex AI solution insead of a less expensive, more traditional solution?

options.c: In more efficiently identifying manufacturing defects.
options.b: In forecasting volumes for manufacturing.
options.d: For choosing what hardware and software would be best for the job.
options.a: In determining what the yield will be.

questions.question: In our widget example, where would investing in AI deep learning be the least appropriate solution?

options.b: In determining what the yield will be based on multiple manufacturing variables.
options.c: In choosing what experts would be best for the job.
options.a: In more efficiently identifying manufacturing visual defects.

questions.question: When should you initiate customer conversations about what hardware/software will be optimal to train and deploy AI?

options.a: In the first meeting about potentially implementing AI.
options.d: In the middle of the AI lifecycle, when evaluating success in translating data.
options.b: Early on in the AI lifecycle, when defining what steps should be taken to translate the data.
options.c: Fairly late in the process, during the Infrastructure stage of the AI lifecycle.

questions.question: Before engaging with potential AI customers, it is very important to _____.

options.a: know the name and specific function of all available AI frameworks and topologies
options.d: become an armchair expert in the science of Business Intelligence (BI)
options.b: learn the common jargon, major players, macro-level forces, and key historical events of AI

questions.question: Which AI approach is used to identify manufacturing defects from images?

options.b: Business Intelligence

questions.question: What makes AI essential for power production and distribution?

options.b: It maximizes production efficiency and system uptime
options.a: It reduces the need for power plants

questions.question: What is the projected impact of AI on IT operations?

options.c: AI will only affect software development
options.a: AI will have minimal impact on IT
options.d: AI adoption in IT will be slow
options.b: Most CIOs will aggressively apply AI to IT operations, tools, and processes
